00056 public class MapActivity extends FragmentActivity
00057         implements OnMarkerClickListener, OnInfoWindowClickListener, OnMarkerDragListener {
00058     private static final LatLng BRISBANE = new LatLng(-27.47093, 153.0235);
00059     private static final LatLng MELBOURNE = new LatLng(-37.81319, 144.96298);
00060     private static final LatLng SYDNEY = new LatLng(-33.87365, 151.20689);
00061     private static final LatLng ADELAIDE = new LatLng(-34.92873, 138.59995);
00062     private static final LatLng PERTH = new LatLng(-31.952854, 115.857342);
00063 
00065     class CustomInfoWindowAdapter implements InfoWindowAdapter {
00066         private final RadioGroup mOptions;
00067 
00068         // These a both viewgroups containing an ImageView with id "badge" and two TextViews with id
00069         // "title" and "snippet".
00070         private final View mWindow;
00071         private final View mContents;
00072         
00073         public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
00074                 setContentView(R.layout.map_markers);
00075                         return;
00076                 }
00077         
00078 
00079         CustomInfoWindowAdapter() {
00080             mWindow = getLayoutInflater().inflate(R.layout.custom_info_window, null);
00081             mContents = getLayoutInflater().inflate(R.layout.custom_info_contents, null);
00082             mOptions = (RadioGroup) findViewById(R.id.custom_info_window_options);
00083         }
00084 
00085         @Override
00086         public View getInfoWindow(Marker marker) {
00087             if (mOptions.getCheckedRadioButtonId() != R.id.custom_info_window) {
00088                 // This means that getInfoContents will be called.
00089                 return null;
00090             }
00091             render(marker, mWindow);
00092             return mWindow;
00093         }
00094 
00095         @Override
00096         public View getInfoContents(Marker marker) {
00097             if (mOptions.getCheckedRadioButtonId() != R.id.custom_info_contents) {
00098                 // This means that the default info contents will be used.
00099                 return null;
00100             }
00101             render(marker, mContents);
00102             return mContents;
00103         }
00104 
00105         private void render(Marker marker, View view) {
00106             int badge;
00107             // Use the equals() method on a Marker to check for equals.  Do not use ==.
00108             if (marker.equals(mBrisbane)) {
00109                 badge = R.drawable.badge_qld;
00110             } else if (marker.equals(mAdelaide)) {
00111                 badge = R.drawable.badge_sa;
00112             } else if (marker.equals(mSydney)) {
00113                 badge = R.drawable.badge_nsw;
00114             } else if (marker.equals(mMelbourne)) {
00115                 badge = R.drawable.badge_victoria;
00116             } else if (marker.equals(mPerth)) {
00117                 badge = R.drawable.alert;
00118             } else {
00119                 // Passing 0 to setImageResource will clear the image view.
00120                 badge = 0;
00121             }
00122            ((ImageView) view.findViewById(R.id.badge)).setImageResource(badge);
00123 
00124             String title = marker.getTitle();
00125             TextView titleUi = ((TextView) view.findViewById(R.id.title));
00126             if (title != null) {
00127               // Spannable string allows us to edit the formatting of the text.
00128                 SpannableString titleText = new SpannableString(title);
00129                 titleText.setSpan(new ForegroundColorSpan(Color.RED), 0, titleText.length(), 0);
00130                 titleUi.setText(titleText);
00131             } else {
00132                 titleUi.setText("");
00133             }
00134 
00135             String snippet = marker.getSnippet();
00136            TextView snippetUi = ((TextView) view.findViewById(R.id.snippet));
00137             if (snippet != null && snippet.length() > 12) {
00138                 SpannableString snippetText = new SpannableString(snippet);
00139                 snippetText.setSpan(new ForegroundColorSpan(Color.MAGENTA), 0, 10, 0);
00140                 snippetText.setSpan(new ForegroundColorSpan(Color.BLUE), 12, snippet.length(), 0);
00141                 snippetUi.setText(snippetText);
00142             } else {
00143                 snippetUi.setText("");
00144             }
00145         }
00146     }

00148     private GoogleMap mMap;
00149 
00150     private Marker mPerth;
00151     private Marker mSydney;
00152     private Marker mBrisbane;
00153     private Marker mAdelaide;
00154     private Marker mMelbourne;
00155     private TextView mTopText;

00157     @Override
00158     protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
00159         super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
00160         setContentView(R.layout.map_markers);
00161 
00162         mTopText = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.top_text);
00163 
00164         setUpMapIfNeeded();
00165     }

00167     @Override
00168     protected void onResume() {
00169         super.onResume();
00170         setUpMapIfNeeded();
00171     }
00172 
00173     private void setUpMapIfNeeded() {
00174         // Do a null check to confirm that we have not already instantiated the map.
00175         if (mMap == null) {
00176             // Try to obtain the map from the SupportMapFragment.
00177             mMap = ((SupportMapFragment) getSupportFragmentManager().findFragmentById(R.id.map))
00178                     .getExtendedMap();
00179             // Check if we were successful in obtaining the map.
00180             if (mMap != null) {
00181                 setUpMap();
00182             }
00183         }
00184     }
00185 
00186     private void setUpMap() {
00187         // Hide the zoom controls as the button panel will cover it.
00188         mMap.getUiSettings().setZoomControlsEnabled(false);
00189 
00190         // Add lots of markers to the map.
00191         addMarkersToMap();
00192 
00193         // Setting an info window adapter allows us to change the both the contents and look of the
00194         // info window.
00195         mMap.setInfoWindowAdapter(new CustomInfoWindowAdapter());
00196 
00197         // Set listeners for marker events.  See the bottom of this class for their behavior.
00198         mMap.setOnMarkerClickListener(this);
00199         mMap.setOnInfoWindowClickListener(this);
00200         mMap.setOnMarkerDragListener(this);
00201 
00202         // Pan to see all markers in view.
00203         // Cannot zoom to bounds until the map has a size.
00204         final View mapView = getSupportFragmentManager().findFragmentById(R.id.map).getView();
00205         if (mapView.getViewTreeObserver().isAlive()) {
00206             mapView.getViewTreeObserver().addOnGlobalLayoutListener(new OnGlobalLayoutListener() {
00207                 @SuppressWarnings("deprecation") // We use the new method when supported
00208                 @SuppressLint("NewApi") // We check which build version we are using.
00209                 @Override
00210                 public void onGlobalLayout() {
00211                     LatLngBounds bounds = new LatLngBounds.Builder()
00212                             .include(PERTH)
00213                             .include(SYDNEY)
00214                             .include(ADELAIDE)
00215                             .include(BRISBANE)
00216                             .include(MELBOURNE)
00217                             .build();
00218                     if (Build.VERSION.SDK_INT < Build.VERSION_CODES.FROYO) {
00219                       mapView.getViewTreeObserver().removeGlobalOnLayoutListener(this);
00220                     } else {
00221                       mapView.getViewTreeObserver().removeGlobalOnLayoutListener(this);
00222                     }
00223                     mMap.moveCamera(CameraUpdateFactory.newLatLngBounds(bounds, 50));
00224                 }
00225             });
00226         }
00227     }
00228 
00229     private void addMarkersToMap() {
00230         // Uses a colored icon.
00231         mBrisbane = mMap.addMarker(new MarkerOptions()
00232                 .position(BRISBANE)
00233                 .title("Brisbane")
00234                 .snippet("Population: 2,074,200")
00235                 .icon(BitmapDescriptorFactory.defaultMarker(BitmapDescriptorFactory.HUE_AZURE)));
00236 
00237         // Uses a custom icon.
00238         mSydney = mMap.addMarker(new MarkerOptions()
00239                 .position(SYDNEY)
00240                 .title("Sydney")
00241                 .snippet("Population: 4,627,300")
00242                 .icon(BitmapDescriptorFactory.fromResource(R.drawable.alert)));
00243 
00244         // Creates a draggable marker. Long press to drag.
00245         mMelbourne = mMap.addMarker(new MarkerOptions()
00246                 .position(MELBOURNE)
00247                 .title("Melbourne")
00248                 .snippet("Population: 4,137,400")
00249                 .draggable(true));
00250 
00251         // A few more markers for good measure.
00252         mPerth = mMap.addMarker(new MarkerOptions()
00253                 .position(PERTH)
00254                 .title("Perth")
00255                 .snippet("Population: 1,738,800"));
00256         mAdelaide = mMap.addMarker(new MarkerOptions()
00257                 .position(ADELAIDE)
00258                 .title("Adelaide")
00259                 .snippet("Population: 1,213,000"));
00260 
00261         // Creates a marker rainbow demonstrating how to create default marker icons of different
00262         // hues (colors).
00263         int numMarkersInRainbow = 12;
00264         for (int i = 0; i < numMarkersInRainbow; i++) {
00265             mMap.addMarker(new MarkerOptions()
00266                     .position(new LatLng(
00267                             -30 + 10 * Math.sin(i * Math.PI / (numMarkersInRainbow - 1)),
00268                             135 - 10 * Math.cos(i * Math.PI / (numMarkersInRainbow - 1))))
00269                     .title("Marker " + i)
00270                     .icon(BitmapDescriptorFactory.defaultMarker(i * 360 / numMarkersInRainbow)));
00271         }
00272     }
00273 
00274     private boolean checkReady() {
00275         if (mMap == null) {
00276             Toast.makeText(this, R.string.hello_world, Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
00277             return false;
00278         }
00279         return true;
00280     }
00281 
00283     public void onClearMap(View view) {
00284         if (!checkReady()) {
00285             return;
00286         }
00287         mMap.clear();
00288     }
00289 
00291     public void onResetMap(View view) {
00292         if (!checkReady()) {
00293             return;
00294         }
00295         // Clear the map because we don't want duplicates of the markers.
00296         mMap.clear();
00297         addMarkersToMap();
00298     }
00299 
00300     //
00301     // Marker related listeners.
00302     //
00303 
00304     @Override
00305     public boolean onMarkerClick(final Marker marker) {
00306         // This causes the marker at Perth to bounce into position when it is clicked.
00307         if (marker.equals(mPerth)) {
00308             final Handler handler = new Handler();
00309             final long start = SystemClock.uptimeMillis();
00310             Projection proj = mMap.getProjection();
00311             Point startPoint = proj.toScreenLocation(PERTH);
00312             startPoint.offset(0, -100);
00313             final LatLng startLatLng = proj.fromScreenLocation(startPoint);
00314             final long duration = 1500;
00315 
00316             final Interpolator interpolator = new BounceInterpolator();
00317 
00318             handler.post(new Runnable() {
00319                 @Override
00320                 public void run() {
00321                     long elapsed = SystemClock.uptimeMillis() - start;
00322                     float t = interpolator.getInterpolation((float) elapsed / duration);
00323                     double lng = t * PERTH.longitude + (1 - t) * startLatLng.longitude;
00324                     double lat = t * PERTH.latitude + (1 - t) * startLatLng.latitude;
00325                     marker.setPosition(new LatLng(lat, lng));
00326 
00327                     if (t < 1.0) {
00328                         // Post again 16ms later.
00329                         handler.postDelayed(this, 16);
00330                     }
00331                 }
00332             });
00333         }
00334         // We return false to indicate that we have not consumed the event and that we wish
00335         // for the default behavior to occur (which is for the camera to move such that the
00336         // marker is centered and for the marker's info window to open, if it has one).
00337         return false;
00338     }
00339 
00340     @Override
00341     public void onInfoWindowClick(Marker marker) {
00342         Toast.makeText(getBaseContext(), "Click Info Window", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
00343     }
00344 
00345     @Override
00346     public void onMarkerDragStart(Marker marker) {
00347         mTopText.setText("onMarkerDragStart");
00348     }
00349 
00350     @Override
00351     public void onMarkerDragEnd(Marker marker) {
00352         mTopText.setText("onMarkerDragEnd");
00353     }
00354 
00355     @Override
00356     public void onMarkerDrag(Marker marker) {
00357         mTopText.setText("onMarkerDrag.  Current Position: " + marker.getPosition());
00358     }
